creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: elegant, tall, slender, triangular form rising from wooden base; widens from base to tip; front of tip sweeps downward as if cut away, showing higher back; wooden base; metal cover fits inside porcelain cutaway at top, made of small metal droplet-shaped cylinders housed within metal triangular form; cylinders form peak at center
inscription: Japanese character stamped in side of metal cover
markings: sticker on back of wooden base: [T-2083]
medium: Porcelain with pale bluish glaze (seihakuji), metal, wood
title: Decorative Incense Burner "Pure"
